sentence.Network_en: His parents' obsession with keeping up appearances haunted his childhood.
sentence.Network_cn: 父母过于爱面子的做法在他儿时一直困扰着他。

sentence.Network_en: The forest was dark and silent, haunted by shadows and unseen presences.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个森林黑暗寂静，经常有幽灵和看不见的鬼怪出没。

sentence.Network_en: The village is haunted by the ghosts of the dead children.
sentence.Network_cn: 死去的孩子们的幽灵常在该村出没。

entry.tran: （房屋等）有鬼魂出没的，闹鬼的
entry.def: A haunted building or other place is one where a ghost regularly appears.

example.ex: Tracy said the cabin was haunted.

entry.def: Someone who has a haunted expression looks very worried or troubled.

example.ex: She looked so haunted, I almost didn't recognize her.
example.tran: 她愁容满面，我差点儿没认出她来。

means.word_mean: 1. having or showing excessive or compulsive concern with something;

sentences.sentence: "became more and more haunted by the stupid riddle"
"got no help from his wife who was preoccupied with the children"
"he was taken up in worry for the old woman"

means.word_mean: 3. inhabited by or as if by apparitions;

auth_sentence.content: A vague, unreasonable anxiety about Elsie haunted him.
auth_sentence.res_content: A vague, unreasonable anxiety about Elsie haunted him.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: A vague, unreasonable anxiety about Elsie haunted him.

auth_sentence.content: O monstrous! O strange! We are haunted.
auth_sentence.res_content: O monstrous! O strange! We are haunted.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: O monstrous! O strange! We are haunted.

auth_sentence.content: Our employment prospects are haunted by our Facebook pages.
auth_sentence.res_content: Our employment prospects are haunted by our Facebook pages.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Our employment prospects are haunted by our Facebook pages.

Sentence.sentence: Before the election, Erin White has been haunted by the question of whether she could go as far as she wanted in life.

sentences.en: The old house is said to be haunted.

means.word_mean: 受到折磨的；焦虑不安的

sentences.en: A wrongdoer is constantly haunted by the fear of discovery.
sentences.cn: 作恶者经常心中害怕被发觉。

sentences.en: She had a haunted look,as if she were constantly anxious or afraid.
sentences.cn: 她显出一种提心吊胆的样子,似乎她总在担惊受怕。

sentences.en: She had a haunted look, as if she were constantly anxious or afraid.
sentences.cn: 她显得忧愁不堪,仿佛一直在担心害怕似的。
